call_sheets.trend_title: India to Rebase GDP Series with 2022-23 as Base Year; Q3FY26 Data Expected
call_sheets.trigger_event: India to Rebase GDP Series with 2022-23 as Base Year; Q3FY26 Data Expected — India to Rebase GDP Series with 2022-23 as Base Year; Q3FY26 Data Expected
call_sheets.pain_point: Rebased GDP series requires updates to economic models and growth forecasts, affecting investment strategies and financial planning
call_sheets.opening_line: Your business faces a concrete challenge: Rebased GDP series requires updates to economic models and growth forecasts, affecting investment strategies and financial planning. This will likely materialize within 2 weeks. We help companies navigate exactly this kind of pressure.
call_sheets.reasoning: The rebasing of India's GDP series with 2022-23 as the base year will have a ripple effect on various sectors. Initially, financial institutions will need to update their economic models and growth forecasts. This, in turn, will impact IT service providers, e-commerce platforms, and logistics companies as they adjust their investment and market strategies based on revised market size estimations for the digital services and gig economy sectors. Further downstream, companies that rely on these sectors for services or supplies will also be affected.
